result.execSummary:
The defendant Kortez R. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 2 years, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $200 starting May 1, 2016. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact with B. Standke directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or contact by third party.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: to March 28, 2025

Case called @ 2:22 PM Defendant Kortez R. Smith in custody, appears via Zoom from Green Bay Correctional. Attorney Dennis Ryan appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Agent James Ortlieb appears on behalf of the Department of Corrections. Defendant advised of his right to counsel. Defendant waives his right to counsel. Hearing to address the balance of restitution owed in the amount of $813.28. DE advises that he has been making payments toward the restitution and the balance owed is $555.25. Statement by ADA Ryan. Statement by Agent Ortlieb - DE's release date is 4/19/2025. The department is requesting an extension for a period of three years from today's date to address the unpaid restitution.
Memo to the Court from Agent Eggum requesting extension of Probation
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Hearing
Probation review hearing on March 7, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Information for Defendants After Felony Conviction - Warning not to Possess Firearms

Case called @ 2:30 p.m. Defendant Kortez R. Smith in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached an agreement. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 3 years probation - Conditions: Restitution in the amount of $3119.63 to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $200 starting May 1, 2016, NC w/ B. Standke, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Defendant may petition for early termination of probation term after completion of 2 years, provided request is joined by agent and all financial obligations are paid in full and all treatment programming is completed. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-28-2016 02:30 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court, appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zamzow requests P/S be scheduled.  P/S hearing scheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference at 02-23-2016 10:00 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court , appearing via telephone.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Zamzow she requests add'l time as offer extended being considered.  STC rescheduled as requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:20 PM: Defendant Kortez R. Smith in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits (10 days) for preliminary hearing.  ADA argues for Signature Bond due to custody status of $2500 w/conditions.  No objection to bond request.   Defendant is currently serving a sentence in the WCJ with 10 days remaining.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:15 am.
